title: Synthetic Recap
body:
AP SPORTS

**Gilliam's Historic Night Lifts Nets Over Kings**

EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J. (AP) – In a game that will be remembered for one monumental individual effort, the New Jersey Nets leaned entirely on the herculean performance of Armen Gilliam to secure a 97-90 victory over the Sacramento Kings in 1997.

Gilliam was simply unstoppable, delivering a career-defining and historic performance by pouring in a game-high 41 points. He was a model of efficiency and power, dominating the paint and carrying the Nets' offense on his back throughout the contest. While teammate Kendall Gill provided crucial support with 24 points, the night belonged unequivocally to "The Hammer."

The Sacramento Kings, led by a strong 22-point outing from Corliss Williamson and 19 points from Mahmoud Abdul-Rauf, fought valiantly but had no answer for Gilliam’s onslaught. Their efforts to close the gap were consistently thwarted by the relentless scoring of the Nets’ powerhouse forward.

This was not merely a win for the Nets; it was a showcase of one man's will. On a night where the rest of the team combined for 56 points, Gilliam’s 41-point explosion was the entire story. Every clutch basket, every decisive move in the post, served to etch his name into the franchise record books on this particular evening.

The final score reflects a team victory, but the narrative is singular. In a league of extraordinary athletes, Armen Gilliam authored a night of pure, unadulterated dominance, a performance that those in attendance will recall every time a player approaches that mythical 40-point mark.
